TopicTitle: Falling kerbounats on Mun, possible suit depressurization

Articles.Content:
My kerball falls and really often on Mun, i know that real astronauts also falling on Moon like this one

It's good that nothing happened to this astronaut, but tragedy can happen.

So i just wondering does will SQUAD add REALISTIC depressurization in space animation

Um. I don't think we want realistic kerbal death animations (at least I don't). The sad little gray poof is pretty euphemistic, but given what I occasionally accidentally put my kerbs through in the course of my space program, I don't think I want to see any kind of realistic injuries on them. That would detract from the humor of the game rather significantly, to say the least.
What do you mean by realistic depressurisation? Because the exploding in vacuum thing is science-fiction and unreal: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_exposure#In_science_fiction
I would like depressurization to be a thing in the future (with the Kerbals just exploding as they do now) but I doubt it'd make it into the stock game. Some modder should do it.

What do you mean by realistic depressurisation? Because the exploding in vacuum thing is science-fiction and unreal: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space_exposure#In_science_fiction

I was assuming the OP meant having the suit visibly collapse around the kerbal and have the model stop reacting to player input. Dead bodies could be an interesting addition to the game, but I'm not so sure I'd actually want to see it.

I like the children-compatible implementation of death as it is now.

A ragdoll effect belongs into other games, but not KSP in my opinion.
